senses.sense_definition: Regulated, controlled, or determined by a single gene.

examples.text: Cystic fibrosis is a <w>monogenic</w> disorder caused by mutations in a specific gene.
Researchers are identifying <w>monogenic</w> causes of obesity to develop targeted treatments.

senses.sense_definition: Relating to the theory that all humans or a specific group descended from a single pair or common ancestral origin.

examples.text: The <w>monogenic</w> hypothesis suggests that all languages evolved from a single mother tongue.
Nineteenth-century anthropologists debated whether human origins were <w>monogenic</w> or polygenic.

senses.sense_definition: Producing offspring of only one sex.

examples.text: Certain species of aphids are <w>monogenic</w>, giving birth exclusively to females during specific seasons.
The biologist studied <w>monogenic</w> reproduction patterns in the isolated insect population.

senses.sense_definition: Generated by a set containing only a single element.

examples.text: In algebra, a cyclic group is a <w>monogenic</w> group generated by one element.
The student proved that the semigroup was <w>monogenic</w>.

senses.sense_definition: A derivative of a function that possesses a unique derivative at a point in complex analysis.

examples.text: The professor explained how to calculate the <w>monogenic</w> of the function.
In this specific calculus framework, the <w>monogenic</w> behaves differently than standard derivatives.
